docs.abstract: Schools that helped produce some of Silicon Valley’s most prominent leaders are hustling to bring a more medicine-like morality to computer science.
docs.snippet: Schools that helped produce some of Silicon Valley’s most prominent leaders are hustling to bring a more medicine-like morality to computer science.
docs.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif. — The medical profession has an ethic: First, do no harm.

headline.main: Tech’s Ethical ‘Dark Side’: Harvard, Stanford and Others Want to Address It
headline.print_headline: On Campus, Computer Science Departments Find a Blind Spot: Ethics

docs.abstract: Facing the loss of more than two dozen newsroom jobs, the beleaguered newspaper is printing an editorial blasting Alden Global Capital: “We call for action.”
docs.snippet: Facing the loss of more than two dozen newsroom jobs, the beleaguered newspaper is printing an editorial blasting Alden Global Capital: “We call for action.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The Denver Post is in open revolt against its owner.

headline.main: Denver Post Rebels Against Its Hedge-Fund Ownership
headline.print_headline: Denver Post, Gutted by Layoffs,  Prints a Rebuke of Its Owners

docs.abstract: A special committee of the company’s board said a roughly $8.3 billion offer, or $50 a share, was too low.
docs.snippet: A special committee of the company’s board said a roughly $8.3 billion offer, or $50 a share, was too low.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nordstrom’s long, winding attempt to move into private ownership took another turn Monday. A special committee of the retailer’s board rejected a roughly $8.4 billion offer from the Nordstrom family to buy the company, saying the price was too low.

headline.main: Nordstrom Family’s Bid to Buy the Retailer Is Rejected

docs.abstract: The country offers generous benefits to buyers of vehicles that run on new types of fuel, making ownership more affordable.
docs.snippet: The country offers generous benefits to buyers of vehicles that run on new types of fuel, making ownership more affordable.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sales of electric and hybrid cars in Norway outpaced those running on fossil fuels last year, cementing the country’s position as a global leader in the push to restrict vehicle emissions.

headline.main: In Norway, Electric and Hybrid Cars Outsell Conventional Models
headline.print_headline: Electric and Hybrid Cars Take Lead in Norway

byline.original: By Amie Tsang and Henrik Pryser Libell

docs.abstract: The acquisition by JAB, a conglomerate on a quest to create a food-and-beverage empire, would add to a stable of coffee brands and a doughnut chain.
docs.snippet: The acquisition by JAB, a conglomerate on a quest to create a food-and-beverage empire, would add to a stable of coffee brands and a doughnut chain.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — JAB Holding Company, the deal-hungry conglomerate, has bought dozens of coffee brands and begun branching out to doughnuts. Now, it has set its sights on sandwiches.

headline.main: Pret A Manger, U.K. Sandwich Chain, Is Sold to Food Giant JAB

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: ‘The Big Picture’ builds a compelling narrative by telling the stories of the executives whose careers were destroyed or made by the changes to the film industry.
docs.snippet: ‘The Big Picture’ builds a compelling narrative by telling the stories of the executives whose careers were destroyed or made by the changes to the film industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: News flash: Movie studios have come to rely overwhelmingly on “sequels, reboots, spinoffs, adaptations, and animated movies” and “now exist primarily for the purpose of building and supporting branded franchises.” By contrast, the number of original scripted television series commissioned continues to break records, reaching almost 500 in 2017. The challenge for The Wall Street Journal’s entertainment reporter Ben Fritz’s new book, “The Big Picture: The Fight for the Future of Movies,” is to build a compelling business narrative from phenomena that are obvious to anyone who has walked by a multiplex and has a subscription to Netflix or Amazon Prime. Despite some distracting lapses, to a surprising degree he succeeds.

headline.main: Review: ‘The Big Picture’ Chronicles a Changing Entertainment Industry

docs.abstract: The hosts, all veterans of the Obama White House, will broadcast a series of hourlong specials focused on the midterm elections.
docs.snippet: The hosts, all veterans of the Obama White House, will broadcast a series of hourlong specials focused on the midterm elections.

headline.main: ‘Pod Save America’ Is Coming to HBO

docs.abstract: Economic pressures are fueling a drive by tenants’ rights organizers at the state and city levels to let voters enact rent regulations.
docs.snippet: Economic pressures are fueling a drive by tenants’ rights organizers at the state and city levels to let voters enact rent regulations.
docs.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — How do you get a landlord to endorse a proposal to limit rent increases?

headline.main: Rent Control Campaign in California Is Taken to the Streets

docs.abstract: The retailer’s stock is soaring, but it wasn’t always that way. The company had lean years in which it told investors to have faith in its long-term strategy.
docs.snippet: The retailer’s stock is soaring, but it wasn’t always that way. The company had lean years in which it told investors to have faith in its long-term strategy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Allen Gillespie is one lonely stock analyst.

headline.main: Amazon Asked for Patience. Remarkably, Wall Street Complied.
headline.print_headline: Vast Patience In Amazon Was a Virtue For Investors

byline.original: By Michael Corkery and Nick Wingfield

docs.abstract: Jordan A. Thomas helped create an S.E.C. program to encourage employees to alert authorities to corporate wrongdoing. Now his firm is sharing in the proceeds.
docs.snippet: Jordan A. Thomas helped create an S.E.C. program to encourage employees to alert authorities to corporate wrongdoing. Now his firm is sharing in the proceeds.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Jordan A. Thomas left the Securities and Exchange Commission in 2011, he could have landed a job at a top law firm, likely earning $500,000 or more a year to defend corporations and Wall Street firms in government investigations.

headline.main: Once an S.E.C. Regulator, Now Thriving as a Lawyer for Whistle-Blowers
headline.print_headline: After the S.E.C., Still Blowing Whistles, and Thriving at It
